website_summaries.verdict: An excellent scanner for budget-conscious shoppers.
pros: In-depth user manual makes this scanner easy to use
Sold with a belt clip, earpiece, and hand strap

website_summaries.verdict: A super high-quality two-way radio unit. If you don't need a set, this is the single unit to get.
pros: Rugged, great weatherproofing, emergency band radio is top notch

customer_reviews.title: but this one is FAR superior in EVERY way
customer_reviews.text: THIS is the one to buy!!!! This is the 2nd BF-F8HP unit I've bought from Amazon and I'm not sure why, but this one is FAR superior in EVERY way. This one came in outstanding packaging, with a FANTASTIC manual and appears to be better made than the other. I'm not sure exactly why my other unit (which is "Baofeng" only - NOT "Pofung Baofeng" as this unit is...) is so different - but this one is much nicer. I have *several* versions of the Baofeng HTs - this is the first one I could describe as a truly professional product. Extremely pleased!
customer_reviews.author: novagsd

customer_reviews.title: Whoops...
customer_reviews.text: The HT arrived in what appeared to an opened /damaged condition. The box was dented in the corner, with some weird tape attached, and the contents had been unpacked, and were jostled around. The battery appeared to an after-market, and sain Baofeng nowhere on it. The radio turned on, but was sketchy, I have several Baofeng 2 meter HT's, and this one was bad! Needless to say, it went back to Amazon.. It appeared to be a nice radio, but, unfortunately, it didn't work well enough to really try it out and say one way or the other.
customer_reviews.author: Lxmyth

customer_reviews.title: Complete knockoff
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a knockoff of the already cheaply made Baofengs. The charger says "Paofeng" indicating that this is a knockoff? Compared to my 2 UV5R's, this radio has even worse receive and transmit quality, even when paired with a tried and proven decent quality antenna. Would not recommend wasting money on this model when you can get better for 1/2 or even 1/3 the price.
customer_reviews.author: amchudyk

customer_reviews.title: Shipped non-working with damage box.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of thee radios. the first radio worked for 5 minutes then turned off and wouldn't turn back on right away. Left alone for 5 more minutes, then it turned on and I was able to program. I will test this weekend and see if it keeps working. The second radio wouldn't turn on at all. It even arrived with a partially crushed box. Both radios were shipped inside another box with lot's of protection, and it had no damage. Therefore the damaged radio box was packed and shipped after it had been crushed. This second radio still will not turn on, even after swapping two fully charged batteries around. This system had also been previously opened as well.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor britton

customer_reviews.title: PoFeng not BaoFeng
customer_reviews.text: While it says " BaoFeng" all over the place, it appears to be a PoFeng - which I presume is a clone / cheap Chinese knock-off. Had big hopes as this was going to be my first amateur radio. Sadly it turned on only once.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart D. Golden

customer_reviews.title: Radio and computer interface don't work
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this radio as I have wanted to get into HAM radio for years. I was very disappointed that the components for the radio don't work. While there are hundreds of videos and info on the web about this radio, none were very helpful as they were apparently made for people with HAM experience. Several did mention problems with the computer interface required to set up the radio. The company does not provide a phone number so forget about technical support. I think this is an example of getting what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Killough

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor. Buy something else. They are defective. You can't charge them. They are impossible to program by hand. The manual reads like they originally wrote it Chinese symbols in Google translate and pasted the results into the manual. So, good luck reading that. Then, Boafeng emails you and says to deal with them directly for any problems. They'll send you a replacement....if you pay for the shipping. I do not pay to ship defective products back to the manufacturer...period. I've been a ham since 1997 and had many transceivers in that time. This was not one of them. Stick with Yaesu, ICOM, or Kenwood. Do not buy BaoFeng.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Ocame

customer_reviews.title: Better used as a paper weight!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Was a great radio with lots of features but that does no good since I was only able to charge it twice before the charger stopped working. I will not waste my time or money again on these over priced radios. I couldn't even locate a good replacement charger that might have lasted longer. Probably will just throw it away and chock it up as a lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: After I bought this unit, programmed it, used it for a month then WHAM! I got an Electric Shock from the metal lanyard loop on the side of the radio while keying up on the radio. Got nowhere with Amazon or the Company that sold it.
customer_reviews.author: Bndtech

customer_reviews.title: Audio quality very low and muffled on transmit
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these units for just over 1 year but had not used them at all until today. The transmit volume on one of these units is so poor you can barely hear your voice on the other one. I tried an external microphone too and the voice is just not understandable its so faint. Something obviously wrong with the mic circuit - I guess its too late to return one of them now.
customer_reviews.author: DJordan

customer_reviews.title: Great range for an HT
customer_reviews.text: The 8 watts of power paired with the newer Baofeng duck antennas offers noticeably increased range over the older UV-5R. Having all the same menus and compatibility with CHIRP programming software makes it a no-brainer upgrade from the 5 watt models. However, I would still recommend using an alternate antenna for even better range. The Nagoya NA-771 is very popular for use with these radios and offers a nice bump in performance while not being overly long. If you really want to maximize handheld range, the fold-able HYS 31.5" antenna can really push your performance. Both antennas can be found here on Amazon for very reasonable prices.
customer_reviews.author: Batman97045

customer_reviews.title: NOT LIVING UP TO 8 WATT CLAIM. They made me send it in which I had to pay for shipping and got it back the same way I sent it.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I received that only puts out a maximum of 5.5 watts. The medium and high setting puts out the same 5.5 watts. I will be returning this one also, more false claims on Chinese made junk, buy American. Don’t wasted your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Croce

customer_reviews.title: Good Cheap HT, not simple but works well.
customer_reviews.text: Look, these Raidos are not simple, easy or plugnplay... They are however fully functional and after you learn how to use Chirp you can get them to do anything the company claims. These are great cheap HT'S that I have used to talk on repeaters up to 23 miles away. In my opinion programing the Raidos from the keyboard is a stretch. The problem is you need to learn the menu well enough so you never take more than 2 seconds between button presses. If you are not fast enough you lose the menu choices you made and need to start over.
customer_reviews.author: Bonner Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Channel?
customer_reviews.text: Received this item promptly, but it only show frequency, whear's channel 19? Guess I'll just need to return this item.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Dame

customer_reviews.title: illegally marketing these radios as Part 90 certified
customer_reviews.text: I have found some unsettling information related to the BaoFeng radios some of us use including the UV5R series, UV-82HP, UV5X3, UV92, BF-F8HP, BF-F8+ series radios I need to share with you all. BaoFeng received a citation from the Federal Communications Commission in August 2018 for illegally marketing these radios as Part 90 certified in violation of section 302(b) of the Communications Act. While some of these radios at the time were in fact certified (the original UV5R), it turns out they still violated the technical requirements or that BaoFeng had changed the radios from the versions submitted for testing and certification without FCC authorization.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are good radios at a great price point
customer_reviews.text: I've been carrying a BF-F8HP since they were first introduced. The dependability, functionality and performance of that radio led me to purchasing the 4 radios for this order. On my communications analyzer, the power output in UHF/70CM averages 5.5W with a fully charged battery. Frequency error is very low as is the TX deviation. Squelch opens at <0.25Uv. The build looks better than my older version. My only wish/desire for these radios would be that Baofeng/Pofung or perhaps CHIRP would include a software option to lock the keypad to prevent unintended changes to the settings. That explains the 4 star rating for ease of use... Still, I'd buy these again. KN4PRE
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: Battery won't lock to radio = useless
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this radio before I could even try it out. The battery wouldn't lock to the radio. It wasn't broken; it's just a bad design. I tried it six ways to Sunday but it would not click into place. Just more bad Chinese manufacturing it seems. Glad it revealed itself as shoddy before I'd had it for too long.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I have personally used this high-powered 2-way communication device to discuss the purpose of life with aliens. The trick is to remove the protective sleeve from the antenna, and use copper wire to connect it to your foil hat. This allows telepathic thought transfer using the radio as an amplifying device. Learn from my mistake though, the foil needs to be TWISTED to a point at the top, this is where you connect the wire. Otherwise, receiving will be fine, but your transmission will be weak.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: got the recommended quality usb cable
customer_reviews.text: Major frustration. Bought the new radio, got the recommended quality usb cable. Tried syncing with two different computers. No luck. Period. Nada, nothing. Wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Rig at a Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: 1. The price is very reasonable. 2. The size is compact but not so small that my fingers hit the wrong buttons. 3. Has all of the features of more expensive rigs and a few extras. 4. Quality seems good so far. I haven't had it long enough to see if battery life is good. 5. Battery doesn't seem to run down very fast. 6. Includes a nice desk charger. Negatives: 1. The biggest negative is programming directions. I struggled with the manual directions and finally searched online until I found simple step-by-step directions posted by another amateur radio operator who had purchased the same rig. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Handyman Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Not 8 watts.
customer_reviews.text: I have several other radios from the same company and decided to test them. I tested the output power on UHF and VHF at low, medium and high power. On VHF I got 1.5, 4, and 6 Watts. On UHF I got 4 watts on low, also 4 watts on medium and 6 watts on high.
customer_reviews.author: rmorgansd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality for this Product
customer_reviews.text: In the world of amateur radio, this is a great choice. This is the third and final generation of the UV-5R. I also purchased a longer antenna for it, which radically changes the radio for the better. It has more of a rugged feel and comes with a 76 Page User Manual that will help you get acquainted with all the features. There is a lot of information also posted on Youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Rusyn

customer_reviews.title: Great first radio
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use when you download CHIRP software to program, even without it the menu system is not all that bad once you get used to it. Just buy the authentic data cable that goes with it. Pretty decent radio with lots of features for a first timer. Everything worked fine except for the phone charger base, it had some issue with the cord being sloppy and it wouldn't keep power on unless I put something on the cord that plugged into it to apply some pressure to it. I contacted BTech and they sent me a new one immediately...nice job! The new one arrived today and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: N. Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Crazy powerful radio with more features than I know what to do with.
customer_reviews.text: Buddy and I bought these for off-road use. Battery life is nearly eternal, 6hrs off road didn't even lower the the power bars on the screen. Sound is solid and easily understood. Note that the included headset is terrible, but better ones are available. The instruction manual is excellent and written in actual English. Ease of use: it's confusing until you get used to it, but when they had to put so many buttons in such a small space, I don't know what else they could do. Overall: excellent radio at a fantastic price. Could not recommend more.
customer_reviews.author: Goldenu

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit and finish
customer_reviews.text: Works well, does what it is supposed to do. Not great on the durability level though. Battery retaining clip broke right off after it fell from the center console of my truck to the floor board. I basically need to buy a new battery now. Don’t think I’m going to waste my money though. From that experience it proves it would basically be useless in the “field”.
customer_reviews.author: Nicodust

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I Love it. Bought two and then another after I sold one to my nephew. Does what it's supposed to. Got a Nagoya NA-771 for one and did notice better reception. I honestly use the FM radio feature every morning. If someone broadcast, it cuts off the radio. Once they stop, the radio comes back on. I've had them over a year and have had no problems or issues.
customer_reviews.author: So Cal Dad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent radio
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a backup to my normal amateur radios. I have an amateur radio license. I was very impressed with the quality of this unit especially given the price. I have an ICOM HT and while this is no ICOM, it's pretty nice. Yes it can be configured to transmit on frequencies which are not legal however many others can be as well including ICOM. This is not an easy radio to program. You can do it via the keyboard but you should buy the programming cable and use CHIRP. I highly recommend this unit as a low cost but excellent quality unit for the beginning ham on 2M or 70CM or as a nice backup unit.
customer_reviews.author: 3ddd

customer_reviews.title: Great Capabilities in a Small Package
customer_reviews.text: This little jewel is great! I like the features, although programming via the device's chicklet keyboard is slow and awkward and programming via a cable and computer is really just filling in a table. Off-line programming (cable and CHIRP software) requires careful setup but is easy once you're connected. Still figuring out some of the details, but it is easy to download and upload sets of frequencies from the device for areas that you might want to monitor. I use the BaoFeng's scan function to listen in on local NOAA weather and emergency channels.
customer_reviews.author: BlueTruth

customer_reviews.title: Great radio for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this radio. I've been playing with it for the past couple months now. I'm using it as a radio for tactical/prepper use. Great sound quality. Haven't got a chance to test range/power very much. Paired it with a BTECH mic and audio tube. I love it! I did notice when connected to a larger antenna on a vehicle it didn't seem to perform very well. It almost had less range. I am looking into this to see if others had the same issue. Overall it is a great radio. I usually use the stock antenna anyways!
customer_reviews.author: tyler

customer_reviews.title: bad!!  This manual is FIVE years old!!
customer_reviews.text: Why do you STILL use this manual when you KNOW there are problems with it?? No one wants to carry a computer around with them when they need to program this thing Other HT's are much easier to program. The other Hams I talked to have given up and only use these for simplex, repeater is just too much hassle. Your service people assume that we are already familiar with this company's products!
customer_reviews.author: dogrobber

customer_reviews.title: The government really ruins the fun of this radio
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I am kind of bummed out that everyone says it is illegal to use these things unless you have a license. And even when you have the license, you cannot use it to talk to someone on the regular two-way radios. Even though it has the ability to do so. This really limits the use of this radio. But it is still a great radio to use as a scanner. So that is what I am going to use it for, since the government of this country has to ruin all the fun and make everything illegal.
customer_reviews.author: THATZLIFE

customer_reviews.title: beware of fakes
customer_reviews.text: be very careful of fakes i have two of these they say Baofeng on them in front but one says Pofung on the inside when you remove the battery cover and when you go to program it it only has high and low power settings not High Med and low like the other. even though they are both the BF-F8HP model
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: 2 Km range in a congested area.
customer_reviews.text: This F8HP is one of seven BaoFeng radios I bought through Amazon. The other six were model type UV5R. Despite the clutter of homes and factories in my area, this unit still connects with my other BaoFengs up to 2 Km away. But you have to use the long antenna and get out of your car for that range. I'm sure it could do more, especially if the line of sight is clear of obstacles. I'm now contemplating a base station in my home with an appropriate aerial to stay in touch with the farm and beach house - after legalizing, of course.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: I am so pleased with this radio
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with this radio. Engineered with more functions than I will ever use. Compact but don’t underestimate its potential. Genuine BaoFeng accessories are far better than the bargain brands. Aftermarket brands don’t fit as well, aren’t made as well, and won’t last. My unfortunate experience was the clip Disenguaged from my belt while I was sitting and fell 2 feet to the ground. Since it landed battery side down the securing latch snapped off. Fortunately the radio, itself, survived. Amazon sells replacement batterys so I bought the aftermarket bargain. Big mistake, 2 days after charging it leaked green goo on my desk. I recommend spending the extra $ and getting the better product.
customer_reviews.author: Rex R

customer_reviews.title: Decent Radio
customer_reviews.text: This HT is a very capable radio for beginners or seasoned hams alike. I have this HT connected to a J-Pole and it does quite well. i have had no complaints about audio quality. With the high capacity battery I can easily go all day on high power. Like most, I did replace the rubber duck antenna with a Nagoya. I have found build quality to be acceptable, perhaps not on par with Japanese radios, but you don't get the impression the HT's doing to all apart in your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Price

customer_reviews.title: Good radio, nice audio, at a great price with plenty of features.
customer_reviews.text: Granted it's not the best built radio, but for the price, it's definitely pretty good! Nice features, backlit buttons, good reception, good audio etc. I've only had one tiny little problem with the tightener around the antenna connector coming loose a time or two, & i had to tighten it back down but that's pretty minor & could happen to an expensive radio just as easy as a cheap one i suppose. I've used this radio almost daily for 6 months now & I've been very pleased. It transmits not only in the Ham bands but also will cover FRS/GMRS or any MURS, MARS Freqs as well without any modifications.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: FCC Certified Handy EMS Ham Radio
customer_reviews.text: Purchased primarily for emergency use as a back up when other communications are down. Studying for ham license so have no transmitting experience to give but the listening quality is good. Heard one conversation on a local repeater in Florida to another in Ohio. So far unable to monitor Police and Fire department dispatches, they probably have changed to a different digital system. Some places I hear use encryption which renders all scanning on those unlawful. Have picked up some local sheriff transmissions, hospital er ambulance including their helicopter. Over all a very good radio for the price with many good reviews here and on youtube. Only thing wish it was more water resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: The Best Radio yet
customer_reviews.text: I already have the BF-F8HP and it really picks a lot of frecuencies like the police, fire dept, emergency units, the weather channel,marine frecuencies, and other frecuencies that you would know once you purchase this radio that you will not regret and you could also comunicate with other parties that why i purchase another one and i highly reccommend anybody to buy this radio, also has flashlight and you could also hear FM stations.
customer_reviews.author: perucho99

customer_reviews.title: The jury is out.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the radio for a couple of weeks and, with the exception of a battery that may be an issue, the jury is out. On Sunday I turned the radio on and the battery, that held 3/4 of a charge before me shutting it down on Saturday, was 'dead'. "Strange", I thought so I plugged it in to the charger. Sunday evening I removed the charger after a 12 hour charge and the radio still wouldn't fire up. Today, Monday, I turned it on and it worked. Not sure what's going on.
customer_reviews.author: DD430

customer_reviews.title: Always issues
customer_reviews.text: Cannot get radio to hold programming. I program radio with Chirp. We go out for a desert run in Jeep and it works fine to communicate over repeater and then suddenly will not transmit any longer. I can usually receive transmissions but problems in transmitting every time, not just occasionally. It works, then it doesn’t. I reprogram and test it, and again, it quits transmitting. My sister has the same radio and it does the same thing. Not impressed!
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Ford

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Radio
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this little radio - We were using Motorola CP185's at $200 a crack - This little radio does just as good, if not better job of radio communications at our raceway than the Motorola radios. So we started buying these instead and were are very happy with them. They are easy to program, cover UHF, VHF, and FM - Sound is clear, and we can purchase adapter cables to connect them to our headsets or any other device we need to. Perfect. We will certainly purchase again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Pete & Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Decent HT
customer_reviews.text: This was my first HT. I've always like how the interface had voice messages confirming actions and menu items. Found it fairly intuitive and the manual was straight forward. Receive/transmit performance seems good, though a better antenna is adviseable. I bought a Yaesu FT60R and like it quite a bit more, but the Baofeng is a fair bit smaller and comes with lithium ion batteries by default which are a huge improvement. For the price, the Baofeng is good. It's no Yaesu, but it's comparable enough that it's pretty hard to tell which is which on the air. Now for me it's a great backup radio.
customer_reviews.author: Pumperman

customer_reviews.title: Knock off radio. Won’t even turn on.
customer_reviews.text: Received the radio and realized that it was a knockoff. Instead of it saying BaoFeng on the label it say PoFung. The radio worked for about one day. Then it stopped working. Won’t turn on even when I tried different new batteries.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM SALEH

customer_reviews.title: They all don't work the same
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 4 of these and they all seem to get different levels of reception in the same areas. I asked them about it and they rudely insulted my intelligence by giving me a few word answer "adjust the squelch " assuming i had not tried to adjust it on the radios before hand & have no knowledge or common sense. I also told them about one radio that stopped working for no apparent reasonwith little use on it & the failed to acknowledge that part of my letter all together
customer_reviews.author: wade zabel

customer_reviews.title: Good first-time radio
customer_reviews.text: This radio works great as someone who just got their Technician license. You'll probably want to upgrade eventually as you get more into ham, but this'll definitely hold you over. A few heads-ups: - You'll probably want a programming cable - You might want to consider a better antenna; I'm happy with the Nagoya NA-771 - The radio may or may not work very well in motion, i.e. when you're driving. You might want to look into a magnetic mount or another radio meant specifically for vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic radio (I lied, its dead after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: If you liked the uv-5r, this is a must have. Period. The little bump in power makes a huge difference. Update 11/1/2020- I retract my prior review of 5 starts to a 1 star. Just under 3 months in and the radio is dead. The radio stays mounted in my Jeep. Secure, and safe. Never dropped, never abused. Im afraid that if reliability is what you're looking for, this may not be the best route.
customer_reviews.author: AllenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: 1.75 miles in a wooded hilly area of New England
customer_reviews.text: Pros -Set it up to connect to a cheap low watt radio my son has. I talked and drove for right around 1.75 miles out from the house before he let me know he'd lost my radio signal (we used cell phones to communicate the loss). I'd say not bad since we live in a heavily wooded area with hills. Setting it up with repeaters can only make it better. Con- it's not intuitive to configure manually, you will need to purchase the programming cable and download some freeware to help you configure the channels and settings you need.
customer_reviews.author: I don't want a Pen Name..

customer_reviews.title: Good radio charger not working.
customer_reviews.text: Charger that came with it did not work. Have another charger so not enough to send it back. Antenna that comes with this is much better than the one that comes cheaper 5 models. Almost as good as my Nagoya 771. To program this with Chirp you have to download your radio setup and cut and paste into it and send it back to the radio. If you try to clone it from a different model you will get a firmware does not match error. Update. After using 2 radios to search the same frequencies it appears that the antenna that comes with this is as good as the Nagoya.
customer_reviews.author: Allen D. Vestal

customer_reviews.title: Great for use as a walkie talkie
customer_reviews.text: The price is great and if you stick to the FRS frequency they work fine as walkie talkies. I'm sure that you can get in trouble with the Ham guys by using "their" frequencies, but when using FRS channels these make a nice, light, cheap option. We use them hiking and rock climbing and easily get 1+ mile range in hilly areas or at least 3-5 miles when one side is on the top of a hill and the other low in the valley.
customer_reviews.author: David D

customer_reviews.title: Best Communication Device for an Emergency
customer_reviews.text: This BaoFeng radio, used with the Nagoya NA-771 15.6-Inch Whip VHF/UHF (144/430Mhz) Antenna SMA-Female for BTECH and BaoFeng Radios, is the best device, for the price, I've found. I live in a mountainous area with family spread throughout the valley. Finding the right device to communicate with them has been a struggle, with most having very limited range, particularly in areas that appear to block line-of-sight. However, with this radio and the antenna I've mentioned I can hear my son, who is 32 miles away, 4X5. You can spend A LOT more and get less, but for me this is perfect in case of an emergency where normal communications may not be available.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Donegan

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for prime time.
customer_reviews.text: Dual watch does not function. It will not switch to the active channel like my UV-5R does. If you have duplex set to (none) the offset is NOT ignored. Those are the only bugs I have found thus far, I expect more. Thus I can't see any advantage to this radio's added cost. When you run CHIRP on it, you get a warning that says it's not ready for prime time. The power 8 watts seems a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Chet

customer_reviews.title: Junk,don't spend your money!
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected,also bought cable to down load frequencies from the computer.I still haven't been able to use it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A really great scanner...
customer_reviews.text: Really like it for what we wanted, set up as a scanner. Size surprised me, it is small...but it's performance is fantastic....go to YouTube and look for videos on programming....plus , remember, without a license, it cannot be used as certain types of radio with transmission function's..... I looked at really high dollar scanner's , and with a lot of police and emergency depts using scramblers, there is no benefit to the increased cost....rsbhunter
customer_reviews.author: rsb

customer_reviews.title: Very nice radio/transmitter. Reprogrammed with CHIRP on Linux for local stations/repeaters.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice radio/transmitter. Got mine programmed to US and English language. Downloaded CHIRP from Baofeng web site for Linux (Ubuntu 18.04), reprogrammed for local repeaters (also bought recommended by Amazon programming cable which works very well), changed other options - easy to use, nice to have all configuration saved on laptop and update time to time - reprogramming/upload to radio operation usually takes around 20 seconds. Fun to use, getting my ham radio license soon! Seller - Amazon - as usual - next day which is nice but boring already - so 5 starts as well.
customer_reviews.author: Vas Ast

customer_reviews.title: Big radio little price
customer_reviews.text: This little radio rocks I use it every day at work, with the volunteer fire department, and to chat with my ham buddies I can run it usually 2 days on a charge even with a decent amount of use pretty impressed with it it has out performed my 2000 dollar bk in allot of areas though it hasn't been hit with a tanker drop yet but it has handled a structure fire internal just fine for what I paid its easily the best bang for the buck I've had 6 others buy this radio just from seeing mine in action including the county road dept who ordered 30 of them for the road crews
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B.

customer_reviews.title: Great radio-
customer_reviews.text: A great radio, especially for the price. The quality is very good...It has a good feel, and the construction of the radio is very good. The programming can be tedious and takes time if you program it manually. Make sure to buy the programming cable, and use a computer along with the CHIRP software to program it. I may actually buy another one of these radios as a spare...It is that good. It also transmits outside of the allocated frequencies, but of course that would be in violation of FCC rules, so DON"T DO IT. It can monitor FRS, GMRS, Murs frequencies and more. I would highly recommend this radio.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R. Newman

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, and dependable
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a handheld. A little tricky to figure out but YouTube solved all my complaints in that matter. Has a good distance but nowhere near my 50w truck radio. Listening to the repeater though I get very good reception and clarity. Its very small and has all the features needed for the average HAM tech. For the price I haven't seen anything that can compete with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Tinelli

customer_reviews.title: Perfect HT radio for beginners!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great radio for the price, obviously this is a under $50 HT with 8 watts max, a small radio with limitations. Once the repeaters are programmed in, your good to go. I added the suggested 19” antenna for around $25. This radio can be connected to an automobile mag mount antenna for better reception AND connected to a full sized antenna for greater strength...all connections need antenna connectors which are $2-5 each only.
customer_reviews.author: tim burke

customer_reviews.title: This is worth the extra money over the other BaoFengs
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint was that there was some overflow on the plastic material in the volume control that was rubbing against the base of the radio. I had to pull off the volume control knob and sand it down and now it's smooth. Otherwise, excellent radio. I can pick up repeaters over 30 miles away with the authentic Nagoya NA-771. Battery life is good. All features seem to work well. Haven't transmitted on it as I'm not yet licensed so I'll update this review after I get my license later this month. Charger only has 2 prongs so this may not be the best but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Just a hobbyist.

customer_reviews.title: Returned ... not able to program!
customer_reviews.text: I give up. After trying two different cables, spending hours trying to connect, using two different PCs, I give up. I could never get the Chirp software to work with this radio. Many people have wonderful reviews and I’m happy for them. For me, I will try a different brand of radio. My recommendation is give this radio a try, but expect to return it. I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Pi4me

customer_reviews.title: Love this radio
customer_reviews.text: This is my first handheld dual band radio. I really love it, very easy to use. I am using the the PC software called Chirp to program more easily, it's available from the Baofeng website. They fixed the issue of flipping to the wrong channel when talking while using TDR, but that might have only been an issue on other models. Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My friends went Rugged - I went BaoFeng -- So glad I saved $$$
customer_reviews.text: This radio lasts forever on a battery charge (4 days off roading, still has life) and it seems to have longer and clearer range then my friends more expensive radios (similar watts). They have name brands, and now they wish they went the BaoFeng route. There's a little learning curve in switching channels and getting the basics dialed in, but the instructions are clear and it does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan James Ross

customer_reviews.title: It works good enough
customer_reviews.text: For the price you pay it's 5 stars. For it's performance and ease of use it's a solid 4. Use it quite a bit while ATV or fishing - not worried about it getting dropped, smashed, wet etc. Not an Icom or Motorola but those aren't $40 either
customer_reviews.author: NH Proud

customer_reviews.title: Nice features, but didn't last more than a week.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my first ham radio to get me on the air when I got my Technician license. It has some really great features, but the quality isn't the best. Within the first week of light use, the radio went into transmit mode and stayed there. Thanks to Amazon's great return policy, I sent it back for a Baofeng BF-F9 that seems to have a little better build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Browncoats Unite!Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great handheld at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: I must admit, I enjoy watching my Jeep Ham-snob friends growl a bit at this unit. It is powerful, clear, and easy to use. It's features are far more numerous than I will ever need. At the time of this review, I've owned and used this unit for over 1.5 years. It continues to impress. I now keep a second one as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Floaty.

customer_reviews.title: What to buy with your BaoFeng Handheld Ham-Radio
customer_reviews.text: Buy the Programming Cable, a Nagoya NA-771 15.6-Inch Whip VHF/UHF (144/430Mhz) Antenna or an ABBREE SMA-Female Dual Band VHF/UHF 144/430MHz High Gain Soft Whip Foldable CS Tactical Antenna, a “Walkie-Talkie” Holster, and a “Commountain” 8541724367 external Mic if you plan to holster your Radio on a backpack or Duty Belt. It’s better than the BaoFeng model and is heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: RED-DVL

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio for the Price, even better than my old Kenwood at 5 times the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great Radio and you can't beat the price for it's capabilities. Don't waste you time trying to program manually or try to save a buck and buy one of the hundreds of $5 programming cables off ebay. These programming cables have a chip and actually require a driver to recognize the cable. Just spend the ridiculous $20 for the OEM cable, curse a little to yourself about the price, and don't look back, Use Free CHIRP download to program your radio and you'll be in happy land!
customer_reviews.author: chickenwarrior

customer_reviews.title: good radio, check your version
customer_reviews.text: i got one about a month ago, works well. i ordered a second one last week, and it was a fake. when you get yours, check your firmware in chirp. if it doesn't say F8-HP it's a fake. my second one says 18-HP and is of a lower quality. i'm exchanging it, hope they send me a real one next time.
customer_reviews.author: jeffp

customer_reviews.title: Good deal.  Works well to one mike.
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat little product. In the suburbs it works well to about a mile. It’s very fully functioned. You need to invest about an hour in training. My one suggestion is there needs to be a way to recharge off a car lighter, batteries or a usb. Your only option is the power cradle plugged into an AC outlet, which is a major problem for prep. I am working out a solution but so far no luck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great radio for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with this little radio. I live 12 miles from the repeater and it comes in crystal clear even with the rubber ducky antenna. My friend helped my program all the local repeaters in the area. He had the cable. You will need to do this to add the repeater tone code and to make it easier to set up. I replaced the antenna with a Nagoya 77 and so far so good. It is a great radio for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: AJK

customer_reviews.title: Many part failures
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 27 units to use for a 10 day event (tournament) Radios were used to communicate with transportation, staff, CBS Sports, referees, tournament desk etc. The radios met or exceeded our expectations....but Many of the parts antenna, earbuds are now in a box as they failed. Would like to be able to get these parts replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Jim

customer_reviews.title: Surprising performance for the money...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't been on the VHF/UHF bands for a while and wasn't sure I wanted to invest a lot in a radio just to be disappointed in the utility of it. The BaoFeng 8 watt dual band hand held seemed like a no risk investment and I have been very pleased with how well it works. Most of the time I have it connected to a dual band mag mount antenna in my vehicle and it hears and reaches distant repeaters quite well. Audio reports are good and programming was easy with the programming cable and free software available on line, so far so good, if it holds up I'll be very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Stevegr

customer_reviews.title: Great radio!
customer_reviews.text: Great radio, like the new generation of 8 watts having more power; reliability when used. As for programming, still learning. However appears easy as with operations. This model seems more durable too!
customer_reviews.author: Mgervais

customer_reviews.title: A must have for SHTF  This is so much more than a walkie talkie.
customer_reviews.text: OK so there is a little learning curve if you have never had a radio like this. But that is why it is so good. This is so much more than a walkie talkie. Consider the programming cable and an additional antenna that can boost the reception. Battery life is great but there is an extended battery available as well. There is a ton of good videos to be found online about this specific radio and shortwave in general. But a must have for the disaster preparedness.
customer_reviews.author: Vermont Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive entry level radio.
customer_reviews.text: Get the programming cable, upgraded antenna, and upgraded battery. This is a fine entry level HT. You don't want to try to program this radio with the keypad, get the cable. Get your HAM license, this radio isn't transmit legal without one. Only takes a few hours to study and the exam is free to a few dollars in cost. Check out ARRL for licensing info. 73 KO4AKP
customer_reviews.author: Jason Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Have had one for two years, this is my second one.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent radio for the price. I've been so happy with it that I bought this one as a backup. Use Chirp to program it and you will really enjoy using this radio. There are other, nicer radios available, but they will come in at over double the price. Absolutely the radio to start off with if you're new to the hobby. 73, K1RCE.
customer_reviews.author: Fine Opine

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Used it after an earthquake.
customer_reviews.text: Summary: I was in an area that had an earthquake as I was on a field study. The utility grid went out so communications were challenging. The team I was with, who were distributed over several miles, has several of these models. They worked great when we needed them. No problems, range was good, voices were clear, and battery life was good. And it did help when everyone was briefly trained to use the radios.
customer_reviews.author: JKN

customer_reviews.title: Not truly 8watt just an fyi
customer_reviews.text: Not truly 8watt, these radios say they are 8watt and I went and spent the money vs the counterfeit ones for $35(UV-5tp) which I was getting about 4 and some stations 8...these at best I could get about 5 watt, look at youtube it's apparently a common thing...just know what you're getting
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: You want this Radio !
customer_reviews.text: I was unsure about buying this radio, I had never heard of this brand, and honestly, I didn't trust the ad...After looking a few times at this radio, I decided to give it a try... Okay, I was wrong about this radio... It works as good as the brand named radios.... I was stunned at how well it did work... If your looking for a VERY good radio, at a very good price, then hands down, this is the radio you want
customer_reviews.author: Mike Boswell

customer_reviews.title: Lots of features
customer_reviews.text: Was a nice built radio with what seemed to be lots of features at an amazing price. The problem was I could never receive anything from a repeater. I followed the instructions and thought everything was correct but nothing ever came in. After a week of working with it and receiving help from other hams , with still no results, I gave up. I know it was probably an IO error but that’s how it is sometimes
customer_reviews.author: Rackon

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I'm honestly not sure how BaoFeng produces such a high quality and full featured product for this retail price. The quality of construction and design hearkens back to decades ago when Motorola produced bullet proof communications products that lasted and lasted under years of hard industrial use.The size, feature set, and battery life are incredible. I wish they would make their latest high capacity battery that comes with this product available separately as a spare though.
customer_reviews.author: J. Boutilier

customer_reviews.title: Nice but previously used it appears
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice looking radio, but I think it was opened and handled by a previous purchaser who returned it. The antenna and the battery was in the wrong place and it was missing a description card that was included with other purchasers radios that I know. Value of the radio seems good, but I wish they didn’t send me a used one. I’ll probably think twice about ordering again from them.
customer_reviews.author: S. Spinner

customer_reviews.title: Great starter unit for amateur radio
customer_reviews.text: I just renewed my technician license and upgraded to general class. I purchased this handytalkie to mostly listen to the 2 meter and 70 cm bands. I want to see if i will spark an interest again. It's been over 30 years since i was on and this is a great unit to get started. I downloaded the "chirp" software to program the unit and it works fine. I have programed all the local repeaters in amd have enjoyed listening. It's nice that it also goes on the FRS band if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Buy them B4 the FCC BAN'S them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for deer hunting parties, on a 250 acre lease, hills, valleys and pure distance, are no match for the power or clarity of these radios, on FMRS, channels. They are solid and extremely reliable. I bought the extra, larger batteries and extra smaller antennas. All together, under $100 each. Best investment. The power output of these radios will be banned by the FCC, soon. If you have been thinking about buying a couple, you better not wait any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Mhester

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this radio for work. The company I work for uses a frequency in the 2 meter band and since it is difficult to get a company radio I decided to purchase my own. I also will be pursuing getting my ham license as a team mate is a active ham and encouraging me. This is a great little radio! If you get the programming cable it makes it easier to program. You can also put in your local law enforcement and fire departments and have it set where you cannot key up on them. I am very happy with this baofeng radio and would recommend it to anybody. Great job baofeng!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Giles

customer_reviews.title: Feature-rich Radio
customer_reviews.text: - for the money, this radio has all the simple features you want - I was satisfied with the first purchase that I bought a second one - battery life is good; good for days or more in monitor mode or a full day transmitting - upgraded antenna is bigger than anticipated, but seems to perform well - using CHIRP, you can easily program channels as presets; the learning curve isn't steep - I love that this came with all the parts necessary to be productive right out of the gate - get your Technician amateur radio license so you can properly learn how to operate this radio legally, it's not as challenging as in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S

customer_reviews.title: Poor reception across all frequencies
customer_reviews.text: I own a previous baofeng radio UV-82, which was good for a month or so until it began overheating and the battery would rapidly discharge. As an alternative, I got this one which appeared to be the “higher end” baofeng radio with more power and ruggedness. Unfortunately the device has horrendous reception regardless of what antenna I use. I have 4 various antennas of various lengths and brands, but none of them helped BF-F8HP get a signal worth anything. Couldn’t get FM, Weather radio, couldn’t listen to anything clearly unless the person was literally 10 ft away. I’m done with baofeng. I rather pay 100$ for something that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Siljanovic

customer_reviews.title: Great Radio.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th handheld . This is my second BaoFeng radio. Lots to like. Eight watts out make it a powerful radio. The cost is unbelievably inexpensive. Has lots of features. Feels tough , should last a long time. ( although the last BaoFeng had the keypad start to come apart , or tear ). But it still gets a 5 star from me. Extra batteries are very inexpensive too . The only thing is it's not easy to program from anything but a computer. Keypad programing is very difficult at best. Still overall a great radio.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey B.

customer_reviews.title: Poor craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: This is garbage. You get what you pay for. This radio had an inop #2 button which makes frequency inputs and menu navigation impossible. I bought the program cable but CHIRP couldn't find the radio (put that in a search engine before you purchase this and you'll see what I mean.) Also, the belt clip comes unattached. This one was so poorly manufactured, it was impossible to attach to the existing radio screws. Sure I returned for a refund but you have to ask - What's you time worth? I spent a lot of time trying to make this work. I'd rather pay a higher price for something plug & play.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the uv5r no doubt
customer_reviews.text: Great product i tested it out with a uv5r i have and the uv5r could hear my transmissions from 3 miles away through a forested park and past alot of building and houses in NYC in my car. But the uv5r couldnt transmit back so the F8HP is a better choice no doubt. Will buy another one to replace my uv5r.
customer_reviews.author: Rajeshram Sadhu

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cheap HT
customer_reviews.text: Want a super-affordable 2m/70cm HT? The BF-F8HP excels at being just that. Maybe you're a beginner, wanting to learn the basics of amateur radio, and wanting to listen in (not legal to broadcast until you're licensed) while you're studying for the test. Maybe you're like me and want something small, portable, and affordable enough that you can use for backup/hiking/shtf/whatever your reason. This unit is exactly that. If you're looking for serious car-mounted or base station use, extreme quality, or something you can pass down to your grandkids, go get a Kenwood or Yaesu. This is a great backup unit though. One recommendation: do NOT program it directly. Purchase or borrow a USB cable, and download CHIRP.
customer_reviews.author: Tai

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: The radio so far works like my UV-5R, uses the same accessories which was a major reason I choose it. I was a little taken back when I saw the dates of the unit, more than a year previous to my purchase. We have 7 of these radios in our group, we use them while traveling and riding our off road machines. Battery life for us has been great, often going 2 days on one charge. I would expect to see a price drop in the future and should that happen and the product line remains about the same I would add one or two just to have the extra range.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Mestek

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the price, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: Great radios for the jobsite, although somewhat noisy. Even with squelch at maximum, or on "tone squelch" these radios are still influenced by interference, and can't seem to keep their speakers shut! It doesn't bother me that much, but my co-workers refuse to use them for that reason. Power is great, sensitivity is great, but they still crackle all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Klein

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent low cost (el-cheepo!) hand held rig! Not as solid as some of the "brand name" rigs but it functions great. Would recommend to anyone new or old in the hobby. The one star off is because it is open and will transmit outside of the amateur band so BE CAREFUL with that. I recommend the programming cableand use CHIRP for the software. The documentation is fair, poorly translated but certainly readable. It is very lacking with programming feature documentation so the software is almost a must.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Muenzler

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable little radio!
customer_reviews.text: an absolutely remarkable little radio! Very well put together. Easy to learn functions - after a little learning curve! Feels "right" in the hand and seems to have superior controls. (Contact buttons, volume control, etc) Bottom line, I would definitely purchase this again, and in fact, I would like to add a second unit to my kit. Delivery was very fast. Well packaged. Zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: MFH Strange

customer_reviews.title: Small, Powerful, Difficult to program without software.
customer_reviews.text: I am new to Ham Radios and bought this on the recommendation of a more seasoned Ham. I found the radio difficult to program manually and then later was made aware of programming the radio though a cable using the CHIRP software. That was what I needed to start with. The radio is very small and very powerful. Once programmed I was able to contact through our local repeater and the signal was reported to be clear and understandable with just the rubber duck antenna.
customer_reviews.author: sailor

customer_reviews.title: Power supply for the charger is garbage.  Makes the whole product worthless
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these. Opened them both up. Charged them both up. Used them for a couple of minutes. Put them both back on the chargers and one of the power supplies blew. Tuned both radios to one of our local repeaters. But, only one of them is getting a signal.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Cheap? No frugal!!!!! Doesnt feel cheap at all. Glad I purchased
customer_reviews.text: So I am new to ham radio. Still haven't gotten my license to operate. I have programmed the national weather service and local fire department to amuse myself. So far I'm impressed with sound quality and the FM radio that is built in. I can see where the led flashlight/beacon could come in handy in an outdoor situation. This radio was not expensive like others I looked at so being q beginner I didn't want to invest too heavily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is my first radio and I'm very happy with the value of it. I didn't even attempt to manually program the radio. I immediately bought the programming cable and used Chirp to program repeaters, etc. I would highly suggest doing so even though the programming cable is overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: With an extended antenna a 22 dollar one outperformed this.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this item because it had lots of static noise. I asked the company and they recommended me to buy an extended antenna. My friends who I traveled with all had the cheaper version and they worked great without buying an extended antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Sonny Bui

product_meta.title: BaoFeng BF-F8HP (UV-5R 3rd Gen) 8-Watt Dual Band Two-Way Radio (136-174MHz VHF & 400-520MHz UHF) Includes Full Kit with Large Battery
product_meta.description:
The Most Powerful One Yet: BaoFeng BF-F8HP (High Power).

The BF-F8HP is the most powerful BaoFeng capable of transmitting 8 watts! A PC03 FTDI Programming Cable is Recommended for Easier PC Programming

The BF-F8HP is the third and final generation of the UV-5R. Some new features found in the BF-F8HP are the three selectable power levels (Low - 1w, Med - 4/5w, High-7/8w); the BF-F8HP has a better high-gain antenna (7") that was not available in earlier models; the BF-F8HP also brings back the customizable tri-color display that was not found in second generation UV-5Rs. The BF-F8HP also comes with a Full IN-DEPTH 76 Page User Manual that will help you get aquatinted with all the New Features!

Much like its little brothers (the BF-F8+ and the UV-5R) the BF-F8HP maintains full cross accessory compatibility with all previous UV-5R accessories.

SPECIFICATIONS:
Color: Black 
Model: New BAOFENG BF-F8HP 
Battery: 2000mAh, 7.4v, Li-ion 
Frequency Range: 65-108MHz (FM Receive only) 136-174MHz and 400-520MHz (TX/RX) 
Antenna: High Gain Dual Band Antenna 7" Antenna 
Mode of operation: Simple or semi-duplex 
Transmitter Output power: 8W/5W / 1W (Max 8W) 
Modulation Mode: 16k F3E / 11k F3E 
Maximum deviation: 5kHz(Wide) / <2.5kHz(Narrow) CTCSS/DCS deviation: 0.5+/-0.1kHz(Wide) / 0.3+/-0.1kHz(Narrow) 
Intermediation distortion:

Included:
BF-F8HP 
7.4V 2000mahvLi-ion Battery Pack 
Antenna 
Belt Clip 
Hand Strap 
Earphone 
***NEW IN-Depth Manual 
Desktop Charger (110V)

Programming Tips and Help Provided at Miklor.com
feature_bullets: Upgrades from our Previous Generation UV-5R: Twice the Output Power (8 watts up from 4 watts output), New Hardened Durable Radio Shell, 30% Larger Battery, V-85 High Gain Antenna (Twice the Antenna Performance), USA Support + In-depth User Guide Included

High / Med / Low Power Settings (8W, 4W, 1W); Frequency Range: 65-108 MHz(Only commercial FM radio reception) VHF: 136-174 MHz(Rx/Tx). UHF: 400-520 MHz(Rx/Tx); Broad (Wide) / Narrowband (Narrow) Selectable

The BF-F8HP was designed in the USA and because not everyone is a radio-expert we really wanted to focus on providing an easier user experience! That starts with the new in-depth manual that guides you through the capabilities and customization of the BF-F8HP. On top of that the BF-F8HP also includes exclusive concierge customer help and warranty support. This concierge service is only available on select BaoFeng models such as the BF-F8HP, UV-82HP, and UV-5X3.
A PC03 FTDI Programming Cable is Recommended for Easier PC Programming

BaoFeng Tech is the only authorized USA BaoFeng Distributor to honor the Manufacturer Warranty. Only BaoFeng Tech offers warranty claims without shipping anything to China. You must insure that BaoFeng Tech is your selected buying option when buying to be able to have the full USA warranty.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars6,048 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Additional Features: Only BaoFeng Tech is Authorized to Resell, Software and Downloads Available at: https://baofengtech.com/bf-f8hp
